remarks: The Principle of Well-Founded Induction.  Theorem 6.27 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 32.  This principle states that if ` B ` is a subclass of a well-ordered class ` A ` with the property that every element of ` B ` whose inital segment is included in ` A ` is itself equal to ` A ` .  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 29-Jan-2011.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)
